definition: Emperor Yang of Sui (569-618), said to have murdered his father and brother to seize the throne, reigned 604-618
the Sui dynasty (581-617 AD)/surname Sui
molten/smelt
emperor

sentences.english: Emperor quickly flash, but the arm had been stabbed.
sentences.chinese: 隋煬帝連忙閃過，但手臂已被刺傷。

sentences.english: The historical effect of Emperor Sui Yang has always been adopted an attitude of negating.
sentences.chinese: 對於隋煬帝在歷史上的作用，人們一向持否定態度。

sentences.english: Sui Yangdi is a mixed blood emperor between Han and Xianbei.
sentences.chinese: 隋煬帝本人就是一個漢族與鮮卑族的混血帝王。

definition: first Sui emperor (541-604) Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604
Zhao Kuangyin, personal name of founding Song emperor Song Taizu 宋太祖 (927-976)

Zanhuang county in Shijiazhuang 石家莊|石家庄[Shi2 jia1 zhuang1], Hebei
Liu Yuan, warlord at the end of the Western Jin dynasty 西晋, founder of Cheng Han of the Sixteen Kingdoms 成漢|成汉 (304-347)

Zhu Wen (852-912), military governor 節度使|节度使[jie2 du4 shi3] at the end of Tang, founder of Later Liang of the Five Dynasties (907-923), also known as Emperor Taizu of Later Liang 後梁太祖|后梁太祖[Hou4 Liang2 Tai4 zu3]

Yang Yuhuan or Yang Guifei 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1] (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], blamed for extravagance and killed as a scapegoat during the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
Emperor Xian of Han (181-234), the final Han emperor, set up by Dong Zhuo 董卓, reigned 189-220, forced to abdicate 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕

posthumous name of the first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦 (256 or 247-195 BC), reigned 202-195 BC
